ratings.comment: Use notes she gives you. Know 'em back and forward. I messed up, read the text and neglected the notes. The notes are most important, but there's a combination of material. Lectures are boring, but you gotta do it. Course says you don't need research methods, but the big paper kinda requires you to know how to construct a study. Again, this hurt me

Professor Ryff is really passionate about her work, and it shines through. Her lectures have probably not changed in the past 20 years, so sometimes they are boring. But the class is informative, and the material covered in lectures and readings is straightforward. If you pay attention, you'll get a good grade and understand the material.
I like professor Ryff. She is easy-going, helpful and welcomes you to her office hour.

Definitely recommend taking a different class to fulfill development, like child psych, because she is a boring professor who mainly talks about her own research exclusively. Often does not allow time for students to write down any of her powerpoint slides. Waking up at 8 am to struggle to take notes because she reads off slides is not worth it.

Dr. Ryff is very knowledgeable about this topic but her lectures are long and dull.  She doesn't present the material in a thoughtful or engaging way. The class is largely based off of the textbook, and you must read it to succeed in this class. There are 3 midterms and a term paper.

Many of her tests focus on the extra readings and graphs she describes in lecture. The tests are straight forward and fair. One big term paper due for the class that I would recommend starting earlier than later, but there's a lot of freedom in topics for the paper, so it's not bad. She's very enthusiastic about her work and I recommend this class.

Extremely unhelpful professor who rarely answers email or shows up to office hours on time and when she does is of little use. Lectures are beyond boring and simply painful to sit in. I would recommend child psych over this class.

Hardest part about this class is waking up at 8am and trekking to the psych building. Lectures are mandatory as she doesn't post notes. Read the book, she asks tests questions on stuff she doesn't cover in lecture. Tests are 80 questions, not impossible if you do the reading. One 10 page term paper and she grades very fairly! I got a B overall

Lectures, book and articles are very outdated. She is a boring professor who isn't good at getting you interested in the class. Class involves midterms (which are very long and difficult) and a 10 page paper. Wouldn't recommend the class, but it's not completely horrible.

She reads directly off slides, but doesn't leave enough time to take notes. When you ask her to go back for a second she just says, it's in the book. Then she spends half the class off on tangents instead of what's actually on the exams, or talks about her own research. The subject is interesting, but she uses outdated sources.
